titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation. James R. Whereas for the more speedy supply of money to defray our present great, and necessary expences, we have ordered a quantity of copper and brass to be coyned in crown pieces, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for alderman James Malone printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his shop in Skinner-Row.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at our castle of Dublin the 15th day of June 1690.".
Steele notation: Arms 185. defray each cur-.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
